resources.string: Kasam
Option Background
Start
Welcome to KASAM Test

The concept of comprehension, the manageability and the meaningful aspect together form the prerequisites for the basic \"sense of context\" (KASAM) we carry with us on our journey through life. The sense of coherence is urgently an attitude that expresses the extent to which one has a lasting and pervasive sense of confidence in her/his ability to meet the different shifts of life.\n\n Please, mark your answer from 1 to 7 for the following 29 questions/statements to have your KASAM score.
Please, type your name!

Mission

Information source
Result calculation
Total KASAM score = M + B + H + Q3
\nWhere M is the score of meaningful aspect, B is the score of concept of comprehension, H is the score of manageability and Q3 is the score of the 3rd question out of the all 29 ones.

There is no one who is happy, enthusiastic, contentious and at high levels of life in a very worrying, threatening and unpleasant life situation. There are people in every social class who are stuck in an unwanted situation, and who do not see a chance to break out. From time to time life is painful to all of us, when loved ones suffer and die when the one we love fools us or even children badly, etc. The one who has a strong KASAM is no more satisfied in such situations, but on the other hand, the KASAM strongly attempts to actively look at the context and influence the circumstances as well as possible, make the best of the situation, take care of what can make life bearable in the midst of its unpleasant. It is for this specific aspect of well-being that KASAM is important.
The used icons are from the Material Design web page.
By using the app, you hereby accept the Terms of Use and the Privacy Policy.
This is a free software licensed under GNU AGPL v3.
For information about the KASAM test and more descriptions, please, click here.

The concept of comprehension is about the fact that both internal and external stimuli in life are thought to be structured, predictable and comprehensible.

 Manageability refers to the degree to which it relies on its ability to make available the resources, both internal and external, necessary to meet all life events.

 The meaningful aspect, ultimately, refers to the ability to see all situations, even demanding and problematic, as challenges worth investing time, dedication and energy in.
You are a healthy person

It appears that a reasonable overall average for healthy persons is around 140 KASAM total points. As your KASAM score is around 140, then it seems that you are a healthy person from the KASAM test perspective.
You are a strong KASAM person

As your KASAM score is greater than 160 but lower than 190, then it seems that you are a strong KASAM person. A true KASAM-strong person can face challenging challenges, and withstand more complexity in existence than a KASAM weak.
You are a weak KASAM person

As your KASAM score is greater than 70 but lower than 120, then it seems that you are a weak KASAM person. There is nothing wrong with being KASAM-weak, but you should think about lowering your ambition level, do not take too much responsibility and try to keep the level of difficulty in the challenges you assume.
You may be stuck in a situation

As you have less than 100 KASAM points, there is an obvious risk that you have stuck in your current situation, and it is recommended that you seek professional help (preferably a cognitive behavioral therapist), not to undergo psychotherapy, but for help to structure and initiate in a structured manner the implementation of a personal action plan.
You have low meaningful aspect value

As you have less than 30 points for meaningful aspect, it indicates lack of involvement in the everyday situations you are most often in. Then you should focus on developing your perspective ability, consider over the meaning of life and try to relinquish more from your own values ​​and do what you are good at, more often put into situations you like. It can also stand for depression and emotional fatigue. Sometimes it may be because you have linked your life to another person or group whose lifestyle / culture does not suit one\'s own.
You have low concept of comprehension value

As you have less than 35 points for concept of comprehension, it is apparent that the everyday life situation is more complex than at present having intellectual energy to cope, or having linguistic or social difficulties in its current environment. Sometimes weak B is caused by cognitive problems, the presence of too many negative and disturbing thoughts, the inability to self-control their reactions, poor self-esteem. Weak B sometimes has a clear connection to \"external control locus\".
You have low manageability value

As you have less than 35 points for manageability, it usually means lack of trust and resource weakness in relation to everyday requirements which can be caused by inadequate skills, poor economy, lack of togetherness, etc. It may also be because of the complexity of life when job, family, economics and others make greater demands than currently envisaged, and it has not yet been possible to develop enough functional new behaviors. A form of cognitive function that can be called self-esteem is also included in Manageability, that is, the ability to believe in being able to influence and be strong.
You are a suspicious person
More than 190 or less than 70 should cause suspicion of error-prompted instructions or lack of sincerity in the response. As you are in this category, please, make the test again.

string-array.name: questions
string-array.item: When you talk to people, do you feel that they do not understand you?
Once you have had to do something that required collaboration with others, did you feel that it could be done?
Think of the people you come into contact with daily, apart from those closest to you. How well do you know most of them?
How often do you feel that you do not really care what is happening around you?
Has it happened that you were surprised by the behavior of people you thought you felt well?
Has it happened that people you trusted have disappointed you?

How do you look at life?

Do you think there will always be people in the future that you can count on?
How often does it happen that you have the feeling that you do not know exactly what is happening?
Even a person with strong self-esteem can sometimes feel like an "unfortunate" one. How often do you feel that?

How often do you feel there is no sense with the things you do in your daily life?
How often do you have feelings you are not sure you can control?
